com.g2mobility.xbee

Class G2BeeService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • com.g2mobility.xbee.G2BeeService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener

    public class G2BeeService
extends android.app.Service
implements android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener
    Service that allows reading and writing on XBee module connected to the USB host via a serial-USB converter.

    An interface is provided for who bound to the service to do requests and get response via the XBee radio module.

      • addDataListener

        public void addDataListener(IG2BeeDataReceiveListener listener)
        Adds the provided listener to the list of listeners to be notified when new data is received.

        If the listener has been already included this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        listener - listener to be notified when new data is received.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener == null
        See Also:
        removeDataListener(IG2BeeDataReceiveListener), IG2BeeDataReceiveListener

      • removeDataListener

        public void removeDataListener(IG2BeeDataReceiveListener listener)
        Removes the provided listener from the list of data listeners.

        If the listener was not in the list this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        listener - listener to be removed from the list of listeners.
        See Also:
        addDataListener(IG2BeeDataReceiveListener), IG2BeeDataReceiveListener

      • getReceiveTimeout

        public GetReceiveTimeoutResponse getReceiveTimeout(byte[] xbee64BitAddress)
        Returns this XBee device configured timeout for receiving packets in synchronous operations.
        Parameters:
        xbee64BitAddress - XBee device 64 bit address
        Returns:
        The current receive timeout in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setReceiveTimeout(byte[], int)

      • setReceiveTimeout

        public G2BeeResponse setReceiveTimeout(byte[] xbee64BitAddress,
                              int receiveTimeout)
        Configures this XBee device timeout in milliseconds for receiving packets in synchronous operations.
        Parameters:
        xbee64BitAddress - XBee device 64 bit address
        receiveTimeout - The new receive timeout in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if receiveTimeout < 0.
        See Also:
        getReceiveTimeout(byte[])

      • getParameter

        public GetParameterResponse getParameter(byte[] xbee64BitAddress,
                                java.lang.String parameter)
        Gets the value of the given parameter from specified XBee device.
        Parameters:
        xbee64BitAddress - XBee device 64 bit address
        parameter - the name of the parameter to retrieve its value.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the value of the parameter

      • setParameter

        public G2BeeResponse setParameter(byte[] xbee64BitAddress,
                         java.lang.String parameter,
                         byte[] value)
        Sets the given parameter with the provided value in this XBee device.

        If the 'apply configuration changes' option is enabled in this device, the configured value for the given parameter will be immediately applied, if not the method applyChanges() must be invoked to apply it.

        Use:

        • Method isApplyConfigurationChangesEnabled() to know if the 'apply configuration changes' option is enabled.
        • Method enableApplyConfigurationChanges(boolean) to enable or disable this option.

        To make parameter modifications persist through subsequent resets use the writeChanges() method.

        Parameters:
        xbee64BitAddress - XBee device 64 bit address
        parameter - The name of the parameter to be set.
        value - The value of the parameter to set.

      • executeParameter

        public G2BeeResponse executeParameter(byte[] xbee64BitAddress,
                             java.lang.String parameter)
        Executes the given command in this XBee device.

        This method is intended to be used for those AT parameters that cannot be read or written, they just execute some action in the XBee module.

        Parameters:
        xbee64BitAddress - XBee device 64 bit address
        parameter - The AT command to be executed.
        See Also:
        getParameter(byte[], String), setParameter(byte[], String, byte[])

      • discover

        public DiscoverResponse discover(byte[] local64BitAddress)
        Discovers XBee devices on the XBee network.
        Parameters:
        local64BitAddress - the local XBee device to perform discovery
        Returns:
        remote devices discovered

      • sendData

        public G2BeeResponse sendData(byte[] remote64BitAddress,
                     byte[] data)
        Sends the provided data to the given XBee device choosing the optimal send method depending on the protocol of the local XBee device.

        This method blocks till a success or error response arrives or the configured receive timeout expires.

        The receive timeout is configured using the setReceiveTimeout method and can be consulted with getReceiveTimeout method.

        For non-blocking operations use the method sendDataAsync(byte[], byte[]).

        Parameters:
        remote64BitAddress - The XBee device of the network that will receive the data.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        See Also:
        getReceiveTimeout(byte[]), setReceiveTimeout(byte[], int), sendDataAsync(byte[], byte[]), com.digi.xbee.api.RemoteXBeeDevice

      • sendDataAsync

        public G2BeeResponse sendDataAsync(byte[] remote64BitAddress,
                          byte[] data)
        Sends the provided data to the provided XBee device asynchronously choosing the optimal send method depending on the protocol of the local XBee device.

        Asynchronous transmissions do not wait for answer from the remote device or for transmit status packet.

        Parameters:
        remote64BitAddress - The XBee device of the network that will receive the data.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        See Also:
        sendData(byte[], byte[]), RemoteXBeeDevice

      • sendBroadcastData

        public G2BeeResponse sendBroadcastData(byte[] data)
        Sends the provided data to all the XBee nodes of the network (broadcast).

        This method blocks till a success or error transmit status arrives or the configured receive timeout expires.

        The receive timeout is configured using the setReceiveTimeout method and can be consulted with getReceiveTimeout method.

        Parameters:
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        See Also:
        getReceiveTimeout(byte[]), setReceiveTimeout(byte[], int)
